meanings.definition: The act or process of sucking.
meanings.sent1: The baby used suction to drink milk from the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner relies on suction to pick up dirt from the floor.
meanings.sent3: The straw had such strong suction that it sucked up the entire drink in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a powerful suction, drawing her closer with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The suction of the tornado was so strong, it lifted cars off the ground.

meanings.definition: The force that causes a fluid or solid to be drawn into an interior space.
meanings.sent1: The suction of the pump pulled water from the well.
meanings.sent2: The suction cup firmly attached to the glass window.
meanings.sent3: The suction of the vacuum cleaner made it seem like it was alive and hungry for dust!
meanings.sent4: The suction of the black hole was so strong that not even light could escape.
meanings.sent5: The suction of the drain was so powerful, it pulled down anything that got too close.
